sen.j: 久我 通堅（こが みちかた、天文 (元号)10年（1541年） - 天正3年4月6日 (旧暦)（1575年5月15日））は、室町時代後期の公卿。
sen.e: Michikata KOGA (1541-May 15, 1575) was a Court noble of the late Muromachi period.
Michikata KOGA (1541-May 15, 1575) was a Court nobleman during the late Muromachi period.
Michikata KOGA (1541 - May 25, 1575) was a Kugyo (top court official) during the late Muromachi period.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に修正しました。

sen.j: 主に後奈良天皇（105代）・正親町天皇（106代）の二代に仕え、官位は正二位大納言まで昇った。
sen.e: He served mainly two emperors, Emperor Gonara (105th) and Emperor Googimachi (106th), and his highest official rank was Shonii Dainagon (Senior Second Rank, Major Counselor).
He served mainly two emperors, Emperor Gonara (105th) and Emperor Googimachi (106th), and his highest official rank was Shonii Dainagon (Senior Second Rank, Major Counselor).
He served mainly two emperors, Emperor Gonara (105th) and Emperor Ogimachi (106th), and his highest official rank was Shonii Dainagon (Senior Second Rank, chief councilor of state).

sen.j: 父は久我晴通（正二位権大納言）。
sen.e: His father was Haremichi KOGA, who was Shonii Gon Dainagon (Senior Second Rank, Provisional Major Counselor).
His father was Haremichi KOGA, who was Shonii Gon Dainagon (Senior Second Rank, Provisional Major Counselor).
His father was Haremichi KOGA, who was Shonii Gon Dainagon (Senior Second Rank, provisional chief councilor of state).
sen.cmt: 権大納言 表現を変更しました。

sen.j: 母は源信光（従三位大膳職）。
sen.e: His mother was MINAMOTO no Nobumitsu, who was Jusanmi Daizensiki (Junior Third Rank of the Office of the Palace Table).
His mother was MINAMOTO no Nobumitsu, who was Jusanmi Daizensiki (Junior Third Rank of the Office of the Palace Table).
His mother was MINAMOTO no Nobumitsu, who was Jusanmi Daizensiki (Junior Third Rank of the Office of the Palace Table).

sen.j: 弟に岩倉具堯（正五位木工寮）がいる。
sen.e: Tomotaka IWAKURA, who was Shogoi Mokuryo (Senior Fifth Rank of Bureau of Carpentry, was his brother.
Tomotaka IWAKURA, who was Shogoi Mokuryo (Senior Fifth Rank of Bureau of Carpentry, was his brother.
Tomotaka IWAKURA, who was Shogoi Mokuryo (Senior Fifth Rank of Bureau of Carpentry), was his brother.

sen.j: 子に久我敦通、娘（六条有広室）ら。
sen.e: He had sons and daughters, including Atsumichi KOGA and the lawful wife of Arihiro ROKUJO.
He had sons and daughters, including Atsumichi KOGA and the lawful wife of Arihiro ROKUJO.
He had sons and daughters, including Atsumichi KOGA and the lawful wife of Arihiro ROKUJO.

sen.j: 初名は久我通興、久我通俊。
sen.e: He was first named Michioki KOGA and Michitoshi KOGA.
He was first named Michioki KOGA and Michitoshi KOGA.
He was first named Michioki KOGA and Michitoshi KOGA.

sen.j: 天文11年（1542年）に叙爵し、侍従に列する。
sen.e: He conferred a peerage in 1542, and ranked with jiju (a chamberlain).
He was conferred peerage in 1542, and ranked with jiju (a chamberlain).
He was conferred peerage in 1542, and ranked with jiju (a chamberlain).

sen.j: その後、備前国、近衛府、備前国、中納言などを歴任し、弘治 (日本)2年（1556年）に源氏長者となる。
sen.e: He successively served at the Bizen Province, Konoefu (the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards), Bizen Province, Chunagon (vice-councilor of state), and the like, and became Genji choja in 1556.
sen.cmt: 備前国が重複しているように思われます。
sen.e: He successively served at Bizen Province, Konoefu (the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards), Bizen Province, Chunagon (vice-councilor of state), and the like, and became Genji choja in 1556.

He successively served at Bizen Province, Konoefu (the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards), Bizen Province, Chunagon (vice-councilor of state), and the like, and became Genji choja (chief of the Minamoto clan) in 1556.
sen.cmt: 源氏長者 を追加しました。

sen.j: 弘治3年（1557年）に権大納言に任じられる。
sen.e: In 1557, he was appointed to Gon Dainagon (provisional major counselor).
In 1557, he was appointed Gon Dainagon (provisional major counselor).
In 1557, he was appointed Gon Dainagon (provisional chief councilor of state).
sen.cmt: 権大納言 補足表現を変更しました。

sen.j: 永禄元年（1558年）に右近衛大将。
sen.e: In 1558, he was appointed to Ukone no daisho (Major Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards).
In 1558, he was appointed Ukone no daisho (Major Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards).
In 1558, he was appointed Ukone no daisho (Major Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards).

sen.j: 永禄3年（1560年）には正二位となったが、しかしまもなく勅勘を被り、永禄8年（1565年）に従二位に落とされ、さらに永禄11年（1568年）には解官された。
sen.e: In 1560, he was conferred to Shonii (Senior Second Rank), but soon thereafter punished by Imperial ordinance, and demoted to Junii (Junior Second Rank) in 1565 and, furthermore, dismissed in 1568.
In 1560, he was conferred Shonii (Senior Second Rank), but soon thereafter punished by Imperial ordinance, and demoted to Junii (Junior Second Rank) in 1565 and, furthermore, dismissed in 1568.
In 1560, he was conferred Shonii (Senior Second Rank), but soon thereafter punished by Imperial ordinance, and demoted to Junii (Junior Second Rank) in 1565 and, furthermore, dismissed in 1568.

sen.j: 京都を出て和泉国堺市に隠遁し、同地で薨去。
sen.e: He left Kyoto and lived in retirement at Sakai City, Izumi Province and died there.
He left Kyoto and lived in retirement at Sakai City, Izumi Province and died there.
He left Kyoto and lived in retirement at Sakai City, Izumi Province and died there.
Died at 35.
Died at 35.
Died at 35.

sen.j: なおこの後、源氏長者の座は本当に源氏の血筋を引いているのかどうかすらも怪しい出自の徳川氏に政治的理由で奪われ、以降明治維新まで源氏長者は正統な後継者である久我家に戻らなかった。
sen.e: Thereafter, the position of "Genji choja" (the top of the Minamoto clan) was seized for political reasons by the Tokugawa clan, whose origin was questionable to leave a doubt as to whether the Tokugawa clan was truly descended from the Minamoto clan, and "Genji choja" was not returned to the legitimate successor Koga family since then until the Meiji Restoration.

Thereafter, the position of "Genji choja" (the top of the Minamoto clan) was seized for political reasons by the Tokugawa clan, whose origin was questionable to leave a doubt as to whether the Tokugawa clan was truly descended from the Minamoto clan, and "Genji choja" was not returned to the legitimate successor Koga family since then until the Meiji Restoration.

Thereafter, the position of "Genji choja" was seized for political reasons by the Tokugawa clan, whose origin was questionable to leave a doubt as to whether the Tokugawa clan was truly descended from the Minamoto clan, and "Genji choja" was not returned to the legitimate successor Koga family since then until the Meiji Restoration.
sen.cmt: 源氏長者 既出のため、補足は削除しました。

sen.j: したがってこの通堅が最後の「正統なる源氏長者」であったともいえる。
sen.e: Thus it may be said that Michikata was the last "legitimate Genji choja)."
Thus it may be said that Michikata was the last "legitimate Genji choja)."
Thus it may be said that Michikata was the last 'legitimate Genji choja.'
